name: vscode-control
title: Visual Studio Code - Control
description: Execute commands inside of your VS Code window from Raycast
author: johan-perso

commands.name: list-commands
commands.title: VS Code Control: List Commands
commands.description: Show a list of all runnable commands

commands.name: scripts-npm
commands.title: Scripts: npm
commands.description: List the NPM scripts that can be executed

commands.name: scripts-flutter
commands.title: Scripts: Flutter
commands.description: List the Flutter devices that can be used to run an app

commands.name: open-settings-ui
commands.title: Settings: Open UI
commands.description: Directly open the settings UI inside of VS Code

commands.name: open-settings-json
commands.title: Settings: Open JSON File
commands.description: Directly open the settings.json file inside of VS Code

commands.name: close-current-terminal
commands.title: Terminal: Close Current Session
commands.description: Close and exit the current terminal session

commands.name: format-selected-code
commands.title: Format: Selected Code
commands.description: Format the currently selected code in the active editor

commands.name: format-current-document
commands.title: Format: Current Document
commands.description: Format the currently open document in the active editor

commands.name: flutter-open-devtools
commands.title: Flutter: Open DevTools
commands.description: Open the Flutter DevTools in your default browser

commands.name: flutter-hot-reload
commands.title: Flutter: Hot Reload
commands.description: Execute a hot reload in the current opened Flutter app

commands.name: flutter-hot-restart
commands.title: Flutter: Hot Restart
commands.description: Execute a hot restart in the current opened Flutter app

preferences.name: remoteControlPort
preferences.title: Remote Control Port
preferences.description: Port used to connect to the VS Code Remote Control server. If you are using a custom port, make sure to set it in your VS Code settings as well.

preferences.name: nodePackageManager
preferences.title: Node Package Manager
preferences.description: Select the Node package manager to use when starting a script

preferences.name: vscodePath
preferences.title: VS Code Path
preferences.description: Path to the VS Code user data directory. Required if you use another app than the default one. This is usually located at `~/Library/Application Support/Code` on macOS, but can vary based on your installation.

preferences.name: flutterPath
preferences.title: Flutter Path
preferences.description: Path to the Flutter binary, used to start Flutter scripts

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
